intro: Faradaya parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered faradaya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
